taskbody.context: You can set preferences, such as grid lines, rulers, and page breaks for existing diagrams at any time. The preferences apply only to the active diagram that is displayed in the Editor area.

step.cmd: In the DS Navigator view pane, double-click the file that you want to work with.
step.stepresult: The file's diagram is displayed in the Editor area.

step.cmd: On the toolbar, click Diagram View .
step.stepresult: The preferences that are enabled are indicated with a check mark.

step.cmd: Do one or more of the following:

choices.choice: To display grid lines to help align the items in the diagram, select Grid.
To display rulers to help align the items in the diagram, select Rulers.
To display page boundaries in a multi-page diagram, select Page Breaks.
To reposition the page break after you made changes to the diagram, select Recalculate Page Breaks.
To align the placement of elements to the vertical and horizontal grid lines, select Snap to Grid.

step.stepresult: The preferences are applied to the diagram that is displayed in the Editor area.
